moves.1. Nf3 b6: Unlike normal, I go with pushing out a pawn on the side.
moves.2. e4 c5 3. Nc3 Qc7: Still leading with the queen in any case.
moves.4. Bb5 Nf6 5. e5 Ng4 6. O-O: Unsurprising move, but a good one.
moves.11. Qxf3 cxd4 12. Qxa8 Bb7 13. Qa4 e6 14: I wonder now what would happen if I brought out my knight to c6 instead. That probably would've been a better move.
moves.15. Be3 Bxh2+: Not too much point, but it opens up a lane to move and puts him on edge and gets me a bit of material.
moves.16. Kh1 Bd5 17. f3 Be5 18. Qg4 Bxb2: Trying to pick up some material back here.
moves.19. Rad1 Qe5 20. Rd3 Bc1: This was actually a terrible move on my part because he could take the bishop with the rook and leave me with nothing for my efforts.
moves.21... Qe2 22. Qxg7 Qxf1+ 23. Kh2 Bf4+ 24: I think I have him at this point. Material advantage and I'm one turn away from mate. Except...
moves.25. Qxh8+ Ke7 26. Bf6#: That happens. He claims he almost didn't see that, but it worked out well for him.
